text: [MUSIC PLAYING]

LISA SKEETE TATUM & MARK TATUM:
Congratulations, HBS AASU class

PHILIP BLACKETT: What's
up, HBS, MBA class of 2020?

RON CHANDLER: Congratulations,
AASU class of 2020.

ARCHIE JONES: Congratulations
on completing the HBS journey.

KAREEM MELIANI: I
want to wish you

the best of luck
on all your hopes,
dreams, and future career goals.

LINDA HILL: The class
of 2020 will certainly

be in the history books of
the Harvard Business School.

And you will all
be in our hearts.

MADDY HALYARD: I know this
isn't what you had hoped for.

But based on my
Instagram feed, you guys

are unsurprisingly
still killing it.

LINDSEY MORROW: And with the
tools you've got from HBS,

you guys are really going to
knock it out when you're back
in the real world.

AMANDA TYSON:
Graduating from HBS
is an incredible accomplishment.

And you guys did it
with so much grace.

MONIQUE BURNS THOMPSON:
I'm proud of you,

and I welcome you to
the ranks of HBS Alum.

HENRY MCGEE: You've
just completed

an extraordinary
educational journey,

and not even a global pandemic
could get in your way.

KAMAU MASSEY: I've been watching
your many accomplishments
from a distance.

And it's been pretty
remarkable to see

what you all have accomplished
in such a short period of time.

BRANDON MONTEITH:
The world is going

to need your strength,
your resolve, your skills,

your abilities now
more than ever.

And I know your class
is more equipped

than most to go out there
and give that to the world

HENRI PIERRE-JACQUES: You are
going to be really supported

during the future,
leaning on each other,

leaning on alumni, leaning
on the rest of your class.

ANYWHERE SIKOCHI:
But it is my hope

that as you prepare
to leave today,

you have at least
one thing in common,
which is to go and make--

ANDY ZELLEKE: --a big
difference to your communities,
to the country, to the world.

BROOK DENNARD ROSSER:
I know that you

are going to change
the world in ways that

exist beyond our wildest
dreams, and I can't
wait to see what you do next.

ASHLEY ARTIM: I hope you had
a wonderful transformational
experience while you were there.

JAMES CASH: I am so
proud of all of you.

And I wanted to send my
congratulations and my best

wishes for you and
your family as we

live through these
unprecedented times.

TSEDAL NEELEY: This is going
to be one of the places

that you can always turn to as
you grow, as you transition,

as you imagine the big
wonderful career that you're
going to have.

BRANDON RAPP: Remember to
take some time to relax,

to show a little patience as
we navigate this new normal,

and that you grace this
world with a little style,
a little personality.
And give it all you got.

Don't let anyone
take your voice.

KYM NELSON: Love the life you
live so you can live the life
you love.

Always remember, don't
compromise yourself.
Give your best.
Do your best.
And expect that.

LES WILLIAMS: We
want you to know

that you are the captain
of your own fate,

but we will always be there
to help you on this voyage.

HENRY MCGEE: Keep
your eye on the prize

and you'll surely achieve the
success you deserve and provide

the leadership we
so greatly need.

LISA SKEETE TATUM:
You are strong.
You are mighty.
And the best is yet to come.

MARK TATUM: We wish
you the best of luck

as you pursue your
next endeavor.
[MUSIC PLAYING]
